answers.answer: my only advice is:  SHE IS 8 TAKE HER TO THE DOCTORS AND HAVE HER CHECKED!

Drinking a lot of water is a symptom  of diabetes. I would take her to the doctor to be safe.That being said, my 6 year old had bad breath for 6 weeks straight. after 2 weeks I took her to the dentist to rule out anything dental.  He did and said wait 2 more weeks before taking her to the doc.  I waited and her breath was still bad.  So I took her. Her diabetes test was normal, and her urine was normal, but it was cloudy with a lot of particles in it.  The doctor decided to send it out for an amino acid test.  Well sure enough there were amino acids in her urine.  She did a re-check and there was a different amino acid in her urine.  She said it probably wasn't an amino acid problem since they were two different amino acids, also those usually show up in infancy and have very distinct symptoms.  They did a blood test to be sure and it was fine. Then another urine had no amino acids.  She told me most likely the filter at the bottom of my daughters kidney doesn't always function properly.  Right now it is not a concern, but may be some day.

question: I have recently read questions about people having moth ball breath.  I am very concerned, my 8 year old daughter has this.  I have really noticed it more over the last 3 weeks.  It is all day, everyday and does not respond to tooth/tongue brushing or mouthwash.Can this be a sign of diabetes or a vitamin deficiency?  I also read that it could be a kidney functioning issue or a GI issue.  Please advise your thoughts on someone this young with this issue.  She has no other symptoms other than drinking a lot of water.
title: Conerned for my 8 year old daughter
